frontmatter.description: The first question you see after browsing through your news and hearing conversations from your fellow engineers is what are Hooks? What can you do with Hooks? How do they compare to writing React with classes? These questions, and more, will be covered in this lesson.
frontmatter.title: Intro to React Hooks

readingLinks.description: An introduction to React Hooks, written by the engineers behind the features. Why did they introduce hooks? What problems do they solve? Read exactly what the engineers behind React have to say!
readingLinks.title: Reactjs.org - Introducing Hooks

readingLinks.description: A code-focused and interactive introduction to Hooks. This introduces our first hook, useState, which allows us to maintain the state of a variable(s) within a component, similar to how "setState" in a Class Component works.
readingLinks.title: Nathan Sebhastian - React Hooks are live. Here is your introduction.

readingLinks.description: Dan Abramov does a deep dive into useEffect, focusing on the newest principles, gotchas, and big ideas from hooks and from useEffect.
readingLinks.title: Dan Abramov - A complete guide to useEffect

readingLinks.description: A list of practices and patterns that you should keep in mind as you begin to write code using React Hooks.
readingLinks.title: Rules of Hooks - Reactjs.org
